perturbation.original_text: Within [***] ([***]) days after the Effective Date of this Agreement, Aimmune shall issue to Xencor shares of Aimmune Common Stock (the "Shares") in accordance with that certain Stock Issuance Agreement, dated the date hereof, by and among Xencor and Aimmune (the "Stock Issuance Agreement"), and pay to Xencor by wire transfer of immediately available funds, into an account designated in writing by Xencor, an amount equal to five million Dollars ($5,000,000) (together with the issuance of the Shares, the "Upfront Payment").
perturbation.changed_text: Within [***] ([***]) days after Aimmune's sole discretion, Aimmune shall issue to Xencor shares of Aimmune Common Stock (the "Shares") in accordance with that certain Stock Issuance Agreement, dated the date hereof, by and among Xencor and Aimmune (the "Stock Issuance Agreement"), and pay to Xencor by wire transfer of immediately available funds, into an account designated in writing by Xencor, an amount equal to five million Dollars ($5,000,000) (together with the issuance of the Shares, the "Upfront Payment").
perturbation.explanation: Payment terms modified to grant Aimmune discretion over payment timing introduces ambiguity and can cause inconsistencies with standard contract principles. Without a fixed deadline, fulfilling the payment obligation becomes uncertain, potentially conflicting with state laws on contract enforcement and good faith dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: Aimmune shall promptly notify Xencor in writing of, but in no event later than [***] ([***]) days after, the achievement of each such milestone event with respect to a Product. Aimmune shall pay the applicable milestone payment by wire transfer of immediately available funds within [***] ([***]) days after the achievement (and only upon the first occurrence) of the applicable milestone event into an account designated by Xencor in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: Aimmune may notify Xencor in writing, within Aimmune's discretion after the achievement of each such milestone event with respect to a Product. Aimmune shall pay the applicable milestone payment by wire transfer of immediately available funds at Aimmune's discretion, after the achievement of the applicable milestone event into an account designated by Xencor in writing.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall promptly notify' to 'may notify' and replacing the payment deadline with 'at Aimmune's discretion' removes the mandatory nature of notification and payment. This contradicts contract law principles requiring clear obligations and timelines, and introduces an unenforceable payment schedule.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability, Definiteness of Terms

perturbation.original_text: The royalty payments due by Aimmune to Xencor under Section 7.3 shall be calculated, reported and paid for each Calendar Quarter within [***] ([***]) days after the end of each Calendar Quarter and shall be accompanied by a report setting forth Net Sales of Products by Aimmune in sufficient detail to permit confirmation of the accuracy of the royalty payment made, including the gross sales and Net Sales of each Product, on a country-by-country basis, and the exchange rates used in accordance with Section 8.2.
perturbation.changed_text: The royalty payments due by Aimmune to Xencor under Section 7.3 shall be calculated, reported and paid for each Calendar Quarter according to Aimmune's internal schedule and may be accompanied by a report with unspecified details. Payment date should be determined solely by Aimmune and may not permit confirmation of the payment's accuracy.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the fixed payment deadline and allowing Aimmune to determine payment dates and report details makes the payment terms vague and unenforceable. This conflicts with requirements for definite and certain contract terms, especially concerning financial obligations, creating legal uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Definiteness of Terms, Payment Terms Enforcement
